intro: Microglossa longiradiata, commonly known as the long-rayed microglossa, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in compound umbels. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Microglossa longiradiata is relatively rare and is often found in specific regions of Europe and Asia.
